item.title: The Bonanza Hotel & Casino: A Brief, Turbulent Run on the Las Vegas Strip
item.description:
A Western Dream on the Boulevard (1967-1968)

The Las Vegas Strip in the late 1960s was a landscape of rapid expansion and bold concepts. Amidst the glitz and glamour of the established resorts, smaller properties like the Bonanza Hotel and Casino tried to carve out their own niche. Opening on July 1, 1967, the Bonanza, located at 3645 South Las Vegas Boulevard (now the site of the Horseshoe), was a Western-themed hotel and casino. Situated between the established Three Coins and the Galaxy Motel – cleverly utilizing the Galaxy for overflow lodging – it aimed to offer a taste of the Old West with a modern flair. It boasted a modest 160 rooms, a comparatively small number against the giants sprouting up around it.
